title: Type suggestions for a logo
content:
Hello all,

I’m designing a logo for a chiropractic/wellness practice, and am looking for an appropriate typeface. I’m looking for something clean, sans serif, and perhaps humanist. Really looking for something that would fit with a sort of new age vitality mentality without being trendy. Feel free to plug your own work, I’m looking for some suggestions to table to the client.

J.

 [‹ Need input on font choice to go along with a logo.](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142640/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30122 "Go to previous forum topic") [A delicate Didone ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142640/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30094 "Go to next forum topic")
author: J.

comments.content:
I also like Today Sans, it’s ever so slightly softer than most of the humanists.

Parisine from Porchez is lovely too.

Jigsaw

suggestions:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-legato/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142640/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-legato/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-legato/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/stone-humanist-itc/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142640/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/stone-humanist-itc/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/stone-humanist-itc/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/cronos/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142640/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/cronos/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/cronos/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/finnegan/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142640/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/finnegan/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/finnegan/") (rather soft)

and there are many more, of course. ;)

// alex

maybe fontsmith’s delightful albert could be right for you. it’s clean, friendly and has personality…

[http://www.fontsmith.com/fonts.php?font\_num=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142640/http:/www.fontsmith.com/fonts.php?font_num=1 "http://www.fontsmith.com/fonts.php?font\_num=1")

There are so many new and nice San Serif faces out there - and that does seem like a nice path for you to be on for this project.

I love Today Sans - but only in the lighter weights. The other suggestions are nice as well.

A newer font that was brought to my attention from a French designer is Kievit. (He is making me use it in a project he is working on - and it’s growing on me... replacing Frutiger and Formata for that matter)

If not for this project - it may still be worth a look-sie to keep in mind when you are looking for a san serif that is well drawn and you are tired of the others...  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/kievit/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142640/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/kievit/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/kievit/")
